content:
The folder are unified, but each acts completely independently.

I think right click the relevant "real" folder, select properties and then check the folder is set to get messages when the account is polled. It is not set by default for Junk/Spam and deleted/trash folders by default so your unified folder is probably not getting a "refresh when you delete because of it.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: right click the folder, select properties and then use the repair button. If it is a phantom that should fix it.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Yes, that works, but since you're comfortable with windows file explorer, you could copy the inbox, sent and other files to the existing Mail\Local Folders folder (without the msf files and with thunderbird not running), restart thunderbird and they should appear immediately.
